head.title: Is 7 Train Good or Bad? It Depends on the Measure

hedline.hl1: Is 7 Train Good or Bad? It Depends on the Measure

abstract.p: Committee for Better Transit president Stephen B Dobrow letter on September 10 article disputes Straphangers Campaign rating of number 7 subway line (S)

block.p: In ''Is the No. 7 a Good Line? Or Poor? It All Depends'' (Sept. 10), the Flushing line is overrated by the Straphangers Campaign because they evaluated two services (the No. 7 Express and No. 7 Local) as if they were one service. Once you measure them separately (as you would, say, the A express and the C local), their scheduled peak service (and, hence, their ratings) are not as good.

In ''Is the No. 7 a Good Line? Or Poor? It All Depends'' (Sept. 10), the Flushing line is overrated by the Straphangers Campaign because they evaluated two services (the No. 7 Express and No. 7 Local) as if they were one service. Once you measure them separately (as you would, say, the A express and the C local), their scheduled peak service (and, hence, their ratings) are not as good.

What lowers the rating even more is that the combined express and local service is now at about three-quarters of capacity. Forty years ago, the peak combined service on the Flushing line was 36 trains per hour (1 minute, 40 second spacing).
The writer is president of the Committee for Better Transit.
